dashboard.description: Uploaded by https://gitlab.com/gitlab-com/runbooks/-/jobs/578914995 at Wed Jun  3 10:09:07 UTC 2020

panels.title: Queue Lengths - number of jobs queued

panels.description: The number of unstarted jobs in queues serviced by this shard
panels.title: Queue Lengths

panels.description: The sum total number of unstarted jobs in all queues serviced by this shard
panels.title: Aggregate queue length

panels.description: Estimated queue time, between when the job is enqueued and executed. Lower is better.
panels.title: Sidekiq Estimated p95 Job Queue Time for $shard shard

panels.description: Estimated queue time, between when the job is enqueued and executed. Lower is better.
panels.title: Sidekiq Estimated p95 Job Queue Time per Queue, $shard shard

panels.description: The total number of jobs being executed at a single moment for the shard
panels.title: Sidekiq Inflight Jobs for $shard shard

panels.description: The total number of jobs being executed at a single moment for the shard
panels.title: Sidekiq Inflight Jobs per Queue, $shard shard
Individual Execution Time - time taken for individual jobs to complete

panels.description: The median duration, once a job starts executing, that it runs for, by shard. Lower is better.
panels.title: Sidekiq Estimated Median Job Latency for $shard shard

panels.description: The 95th percentile duration, once a job starts executing, that it runs for, by shard. Lower is better.
panels.title: Sidekiq Estimated p95 Job Latency per Queue, for $shard shard
Total Execution Time - total time consumed processing jobs

panels.description: The sum of job execution times
panels.title: Sidekiq Total Execution Time for $shard Shard
Throughput - rate at which jobs complete

panels.description: The total number of jobs being completed
panels.title: Sidekiq Aggregated Throughput for $shard Shard

panels.description: The total number of jobs being completed per queue for shard
panels.title: Sidekiq Throughput per Queue for $shard Shard
Utilization - saturation of workers in this fleet

panels.description: How heavily utilized is this shard? Ideally this should be around 33% plus minus 10%. If outside this range for long periods, consider scaling fleet appropriately.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(sum by (environment, stage, shard)  (rate(sidekiq_jobs_completion_seconds_sum{environment="$environment", shard=~"$shard"}[1h]))
/
sum by (environment, stage, shard)  (avg_over_time(sidekiq_concurrency{environment="$environment", shard=~"$shard"}[1h]))
,1),0)

sum by (environment, stage, shard)  (rate(sidekiq_jobs_completion_seconds_sum{environment="$environment", shard=~"$shard"}[10m]))
/
sum by (environment, stage, shard)  (avg_over_time(sidekiq_concurrency{environment="$environment", shard=~"$shard"}[10m]))

sum by (environment, stage, shard)  (rate(sidekiq_jobs_completion_seconds_sum{environment="$environment", shard=~"$shard"}[$__interval]))
/
sum by (environment, stage, shard)  (avg_over_time(sidekiq_concurrency{environment="$environment", shard=~"$shard"}[$__interval]))

panels.title: Shard Utilization

panels.description: 95th percentile Latency. Lower is better
panels.title: p95 Latency Estimate

panels.description: Seconds of Rails processing, per second
panels.title: Rails Total Time

panels.description: Time spend waiting for a rails worker
panels.title: Rails Queue Time

panels.description: Total seconds spent doing SQL processing, per second
panels.title: Total SQL Time

panels.description: Cache Operations per Second
panels.title: Cache Operations

panels.description: The number of times this process restarted in a given period, including children workers. Restarts are associated with poor client experience, so lower is better.
panels.title: gitlab-rails Process restarts

panels.description:
This graph shows the average number of secondary database connections
        per process. A value of zero indicates that the secondary replicas are unreachable.
panels.title: Database load balancer: average secondary connections per client

panels.description: The amount of non-idle time consumed by nodes for this service
panels.title: Node CPU

panels.description: The maximum utilization of a single core on each node. Lower is better

targets.expr:
clamp_min(clamp_max(max(1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard", mode="idle"}[$__interval])) by (fqdn)
,1),0)

panels.title: Node Maximum Single Core Utilization

panels.description: Network utilization for nodes for this service
panels.title: Node Network Utilization

panels.description: Memory utilization. Lower is better.
panels.title: Memory Utilization

panels.description: Disk Read IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read IOPs

panels.description: Disk Write IO operations per second. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write IOPs

panels.description: Disk Read throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Throughput

panels.description: Disk Write throughput datarate. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Throughput

panels.description: Total time spent in read operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Read Total Time

panels.description: Total time spent in write operations across all disks on the node. Lower is better.
panels.title: Disk Write Total Time

panels.description: Loadavg (1 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load1{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"})

panels.title: loadavg1 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (5 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load5{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"})

panels.title: loadavg5 per core

panels.description: Loadavg (15 minute) per core, below 1 is better.

targets.expr:
avg by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_load15{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"})
/
count by (environment, type, tier, stage, fqdn) (node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"})

panels.title: loadavg15 per core

panels.span:
This resource measures average CPU across an all cores in a service fleet.
If it is becoming saturated, it may indicate that the fleet needs
horizontal or vertical scaling.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      1 - avg by (environment, tier, type, stage) (
        rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"}[5m])
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard", component="cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: cpu component saturation: Average Service CPU

panels.span:
Disk utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, device) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      (
        1 - instance:node_filesystem_avail:ratio{fstype=~"ext.|xfs", type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard", component="disk_space"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: disk_space component saturation: Disk Utilization per Device per Node

panels.span:
Memory utilization per device per node.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      instance:node_memory_utilization:ratio{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard", component="memory"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: memory component saturation: Memory Utilization per Node

panels.span:
Open file descriptor saturation per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard", component="open_fds"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor saturation per instance

panels.span:
Sidekiq worker saturation per node.

This metric represents the percentage of available threads*workers that are utilized actively processing jobs.

When this metric is saturated, new Sidekiq jobs will queue. Depending on whether or not the jobs are latency sensitive,
this could impact user experience.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance, pod) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance, pod) (sidekiq_running_jobs{shard!~"export|elasticsearch|memory-bound", type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"})
      /
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn, instance, pod) (sidekiq_concurrency{shard!~"export|elasticsearch|memory-bound", type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"})
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard", component="sidekiq_workers"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: sidekiq_workers component saturation: Sidekiq Worker Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Average CPU per Node.

If average CPU is satured, it may indicate that a fleet is in need to horizontal or vertical scaling. It may also indicate
imbalances in load in a fleet.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      avg without(cpu, mode) (1 - rate(node_cpu_seconds_total{mode="idle", type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"}[5m]))
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard", component="single_node_cpu"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_cpu component saturation: Average CPU Saturation per Node

panels.span:
Puma worker saturation per node.

Each concurrent HTTP request being handled in the application needs a dedicated puma worker. When this resource is saturated,
we will see puma queuing taking place. Leading to slowdowns across the application.

Puma saturation is usually caused by latency problems in downstream services: usually Gitaly or Postgres, but possibly also Redis.
Puma saturation can also be caused by traffic spikes.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (avg_over_time(puma_active_connections{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"}[1m]))
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, fqdn) (puma_max_threads{pid="puma_master", type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard"})
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max(
      max_over_time(
        gitlab_component_saturation:ratio{type="sidekiq", environment="$environment", stage="$stage", shard=~"$shard", component="single_node_puma_workers"}[$__interval]
      )
    ) by (component)
  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: single_node_puma_workers component saturation: Puma Worker Saturation per Node

dashboard.title: sidekiq: Shard Detail
